column4: Anyone think that I can  modify something in the /boot directory that will change my boot splash back to what it should be (IE: from Xubutu (how the heck did that get there!?) back to Ubuntu)
Because I just don't like that little rat guy.
Somehow he's there though.
Little bugger.
I didn't install him, though.
He's just...there.
I don't get the Ubuntu boot splash or login screen.
I have the Xubuntu one for some reason
I would very much like for it to go away, though...mostly because I'm not using Xubuntu.
Also, Admiral-Awesome: I was just going to suggest Arch to you.
sudo apt-get purge xubuntu-artwork ... then sudo apt-get install ubuntu-artwork .. tada!
Well I'll be a monkey's uncle...
I think we were all a monkey's relative at some point in life, lol
have you reinstalled ubuntu-artwork?
okay, have you tried installing the package ubuntu-xsplash-artwork?
you spelled it wrong ubuntu-xsplash-artwork
Hmm... search it in synaptic instead of apt
Od
ah, it is okay, we all screw up sometimes... I rather often

Gratz, now if you want to speed up your boot even more, edit the second line of your grub boot and add profile, you should see a performance increase not on that boot, but everyone thereafter (don't make that change permanent tho)
when you boot, make the change there
lol, nope
